summary: Add support for user metadata on workflows, activities, and timers in TypeScript SDK. Implement the __temporal_workflow_metadata query handler and accept optional summary/details parameters across workflow creation methods (start, signal with start, schedule, child workflows), activity creation, and timer creation.
userImpact: Users can now attach custom metadata (summary and details) to workflows, activities, and timers for better observability and tracking across Temporal operations.
proposedFix: Implement user metadata support across all workflow creation methods, activity creation, and timer creation following the pattern established in sdk-core issue 830 and the features specification.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented and merged, addressing the requirements specified in the feature issue and sdk-core issue.
keyQuote: Accept optional "static summary" and "static details" on all ways to start a workflow and populate user metadata with them
